pages.md:
# SCREEN SETTING

Make changes to display settings.

To access display settings, press **MENU/OK**, select the !SET UP Icon (SET UP) tab, and choose **SCREEN SET-UP**.

!Screen Setting Menu

## VIEW MODE SETTING

Turn the eye sensor, viewfinder (EVF or OVF), or LCD monitor on or off. Separate settings are available for shooting and playback.

### SHOOTING

| Option                              | Description                                                                                                                                   |
|-------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| !Eye Sensor Icon **EYE SENSOR**                | Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on and the LCD monitor off; taking your eye away turns the viewfinder off and LCD monitor on. |
| !Viewfinder Icon **VIEWFINDER ONLY**           | Viewfinder on, LCD monitor off.                                                                                                               |
| !LCD Icon **LCD ONLY**                         | LCD monitor on, viewfinder off.                                                                                                               |
| !Viewfinder + Sensor Icon **VIEWFINDER ONLY + SENSOR** | Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on; taking it away turns the viewfinder off. The LCD monitor remains off.               |
| !Eye Sensor + LCD Icon **EYE SENSOR + LCD IMAGE DISP.** | Putting your eye to the viewfinder during shooting turns the viewfinder on, but the LCD monitor is used for the display of images once you remove your eye from the viewfinder after shooting. |

!Screen Setting Menu

items.value: Turn the eye sensor, viewfinder (EVF or OVF), or LCD monitor on or off. Separate settings are available for shooting and playback.
items.md: Turn the eye sensor, viewfinder (EVF or OVF), or LCD monitor on or off. Separate settings are available for shooting and playback.

rows: Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on and the LCD monitor off; taking your eye away turns the viewfinder off and LCD monitor on.
Putting your eye to the viewfinder turns the viewfinder on; taking it away turns the viewfinder off. The LCD monitor remains off.
!Eye Sensor + LCD Icon **EYE SENSOR + LCD IMAGE DISP.**
Putting your eye to the viewfinder during shooting turns the viewfinder on, but the LCD monitor is used for the display of images once you remove your eye from the viewfinder after shooting.
